article: One day, a woman sat down next to a man on a bench near a playground. The woman pointed to a little boy in a red coat and said: "That is my son _ is moving smoothly down the slide ". "What a lovely boy!" the man replied. Then he went _ saying, "That is my daughter on the bike. She is _ a white dress". After a while, the man looked at his _ and called to the girl in white, "Shall we go home, Mary?" "Only five _ minutes, Dad, please?" little Mary cried. The man _ and Mary went on riding her bike happily. Five minutes passed soon. The father stood up and called again to his daughter: "It's time to go now, Mary?" Again, Mary pleaded , "Give me more minutes, Dad. _ five more minutes, OK?" The man smiled and said: "OK." The _ responded, "You are surely a patient father." _ in thought, the man said nothing. However, after a _ , he smiled and then said: "Her elder brother Tom was killed by a _ driver last year while he was riding his bike near here. I never _ much time with Tom and now I would give anything for just five more minutes with him. I wouldn't make the same _ with Mary. She thinks she has five more minutes to ride her bike. The _ is that I get five more minutes to watch her play. Life sometimes _ too suddenly. " Yes, life is all about making priorities , and what are your priorities? Don't always _ excuses for your not being able to accompany your family members or your friends. Give someone you are devoted to five more minutes of your time today!
